DataElement.preferredName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for distal bile duct carcinoma based on evidence obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Distal Common Bile Duct Neoplasm Clinical N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The section of the tube-like structure carrying bile that is closest to the intestine and furthest from the hepatic and cystic ducts._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The section of the tube-like structure carrying bile that is closest to the intestine and furthest from the hepatic and cystic ducts.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: The section of the tube-like structure carrying bile that is closest to the intestine and furthest from the hepatic and cystic ducts.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-30-19 tmt released.; 12/12/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Distal Bile Duct Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of distal bile duct cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to bile duct adenocarcinomas, biliary intraepithelial neoplasia, high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas, and papillary carcinomas. Tumors arising in the ampulla of Vater, sarcomas, and well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (carcinoids) are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distal bile duct cancer with metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Distal bile duct cancer with metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distal bile duct cancer with metastasis in one to three regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Distal bile duct cancer with metastasis in one to three regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distal bile duct cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Distal bile duct cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distal bile duct cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Distal Bile Duct Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Distal bile duct cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
